summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to PayPal/Venmo on September 3, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to a specific email account. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal laws including sex trafficking and coercion, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for PayPal/Venmo
events.description: The subpoena commands PayPal/Venmo to appear before the Grand Jury to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to PayPal/Venmo as part of an official criminal investigation into a suspected felony.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena targets PayPal/Venmo for all records related to a specific email account from inception to September 2019, indicating a focus on financial transactions.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The document reveals an active grand jury investigation in the Southern District of New York as of September 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
